oai_dc:dc.dc:title: French. Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 37f
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 37 f. Newspaper clipping: fragment: Did he do it? (The 65th Congress met from March 4, 1917 to March 4, 1919). (continued on p. 37 g)
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Politics & government; Clippings; Scrapbooks; Women; Women's suffrage;
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: [Mrs. Mary L. McLendon]
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: C.M. McClung Historical Collection, Knox County Public Library
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For information on license and use fees and acquiring high-resolution image files, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8814. Please provide a brief description of the material.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Did he do it? Has anybody ever heard of his making an effort to eliminate the 15th Federal amendment? Women would like to know if he ever did. "Hoke and Tom" always voted against the Susan B. Anthony amendment whenever it "bobbed up secretly" in the 65th congress, and then what happened? Tom Hardwick was left at home by his constituents who were all men, and Wm. J. Harris is now the junior senator. Wm. Schley Howard who voted against the woman suffrage amendment in the 65th con- (missing)
